required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study of JS201 in Patients With Advanced Malignant Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label, First-in-human, Dose Escalation and Expansion Phase I Clinical Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetic Profile of JS201 in Patients With Advanced Malignant Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open label, phase I clinical study to evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetic (PK) profile, pharmacodynamic (PD) profile, immunogenicity and preliminary efficacy of JS201 in the patients with advanced malignant tumors who have progression after or on the standard of care, or no effective standard therapeutic regimen. This study is divided into three periods: dose-escalation period, dose expansion period, and clinical expansion period.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with DLT (Dose limiting Toxicity)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 21 days after first infusion of study drug
primary_outcome.description: DLT is defined as any of the specified toxicities evaluated as at least possibly related with the study drug within 21 days after the first dose (NCI-CTCAE v5.0);

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects with adverse event (AE)
primary_outcome.description: An Adverse Event (AE) is defined as any new untoward medical occurrences/worsening of pre-existing medical condition without regard to possibility of causal relationship.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects with serious adverse event (SAE)
primary_outcome.description: A Serious Adverse Event (SAE) is an AE that resulted in any of the following outcomes: death; life threatening; persistent/significant disability/incapacity; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; congenital anomaly/birth defect

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects with immune related adverse event (irAE)
primary_outcome.description: IrAE is assessed according to the judgement of investigators

secondary_outcome.measure: area under the plasma drug concentration-time curve (AUC0-t )

secondary_outcome.description: The efficacy evaluated by the investigator in accordance with RECIST 1.1 criteria (solid tumors) or Lugano criteria (2014, lymphoma), including complete response (CR) and partial response (PR).

DOR is defined as the time from the date of the first documentation of response (confirmed CR or confirmed PR) to the date of the first documentation of PD or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first.
The efficacy evaluated by the investigator in accordance with RECIST 1.1 criteria (solid tumors) or Lugano criteria (2014, lymphoma), including CR, PR and stable disease (SD)
PFS is defined as the time from the date of randomization to the earlier of the dates of the first documentation of progressive disease or death due to any cause.
OS is defined as the time from the date of randomization to the date of death due to any cause.

intervention.description: JS201 is administered intravenously Q3W at the corresponding dose.
